varieties.name: Exotic Castillo Antioquia
varieties.description: Meticulously picked, a bold and playful cup, with sweet zesty acidity and layered notes of yogurt, red berries, and caramel after a meticulous fermentation with carefully reproduced microbiome from the farm. Grown at 1,820 masl in La Delia state, a traditional yet refined profile.

varieties.name: Exotic Castillo Caldas
varieties.description: Carefully harvested, this expressive and vibrant cup reveals a sweet hazelnut and lemon aroma, lifted by a bright acidity of strawberries and blackberries, and grounded in a balanced body with hints of bitter cocoa. Developed through a 75-hour lactic acid fermentation, this lot from Cantaclaro in Caldas, grown at 1,710 masl, offers a modern twist on a classic highland profile.

varieties.name: Regional Castillo Antioquia
varieties.description: A Colombian flavor by excellence. It brings a balanced medium acidity with bright lime tones, rich chocolate, panela, and smooth caramel—a comforting cup rooted in heritage.

varieties.name: Regional Castillo Caldas
varieties.description: Rooted in tradition, this washed coffee from Cantaclaro in Caldas offers a clean, fruit-forward cup with medium body and a bright, balanced acidity. Grown at 1,710 masl and harvested during the peak season of October through December, it reflects the enduring heritage and careful craftsmanship of Colombian coffee culture.

varieties.name: Gesha
varieties.description: Grown at 1,840 masl, reveals the elegance of the variety with delicate florals, silky body, and complex notes of jasmine, bergamot, and ripe red fruits, culminating in a refined, almost tea-like finish.

varieties.name: Pink Bourbon
varieties.description: A tribute to genetic enhancement in Colombia. A coffee that adds another dimension with medium lime acidity and a vibrant combination of plum, sugarcane, and tart cranberries. Grown in lands between 1,600-1,800 masl

varieties.name: Castillo Double Alcoholic
varieties.description: Undergoing 48 hours in cherry and 60 hours in mucilage—delivers a layered experience with sparkling tropical acidity, hints of passionfruit and stone fruit, and a syrupy body that carries through to a lingering finish of spiced cocoa and sweet tamarind.
